00001 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00002 ! bianchi2_error_mod  -- BIANCHI2 library error class
00003 !
00004 !! Functionality to handle errors that may occur in the bianchi2 library. 
00005 !! Public bianchi2 error codes are defined, with corresponding private error 
00006 !! comments and default halt execution status.
00007 !
00008 !! @author J. D. McEwen (mcewen@mrao.cam.ac.uk)
00009 !! @version 0.1 October 2005
00010 !
00011 ! Revisions:
00012 !   October 2005 - Written by Jason McEwen
00013 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00014 
00015 module bianchi2_error_mod
00016 
00017   use s2_types_mod, only: S2_STRING_LEN
00018 
00019   implicit none
00020 
00021   private
00022 
00023 
00024   !---------------------------------------
00025   ! Subroutine and function scope
00026   !---------------------------------------
00027 
00028   public :: bianchi2_error
00029 
00030 
00031   !---------------------------------------
00032   ! Global variables
00033   !---------------------------------------
00034 
00035   integer, parameter :: BIANCHI2_ERROR_NUM = 9
00036 
00037   integer, public, parameter :: 
00038     BIANCHI2_ERROR_NONE = 0, 
00039     BIANCHI2_ERROR_INIT = 1, 
00040     BIANCHI2_ERROR_NOT_INIT = 2, 
00041     BIANCHI2_ERROR_INIT_FAIL = 3, 
00042     BIANCHI2_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_FAIL = 4, 
00043     BIANCHI2_ERROR_SIM_PARAM_INVALID = 5, 
00044     BIANCHI2_ERROR_SIM_NARG = 6, 
00045     BIANCHI2_ERROR_SKY_NUM_FAIL = 7, 
00046     BIANCHI2_ERROR_TMPLFIT_FAIL = 8
00047 
00048   ! Each element of the error_comment array must have the same length, thus
00049   ! space with trailing space characters.  When come to use trim to remove 
00050   ! trailing spaces.
00051   !! Comment associated with each error type.
00052   character(len=S2_STRING_LEN), parameter :: 
00053     error_comment(BIANCHI2_ERROR_NUM) = 
00054       (/  
00055       'No error                                                                 ', 
00056       'Attempt to initialise object that has already been initialised           ', 
00057       'Object not initialised                                                   ', 
00058       'Object initialisation failed                                             ', 
00059       'Memory allocation failed                                                 ', 
00060       'Invalid simulation parameter                                             ', 
00061       'Invalid number of command line parameters                                ', 
00062       'Numerical routine failed                                                 ', 
00063       'Template fitting failed                                                  ' 
00064       /) 
00065   
00066   !! Default program halt status of each error type.
00067   logical, parameter :: 
00068     halt_default(BIANCHI2_ERROR_NUM) = 
00069       (/ 
00070       .false., 
00071       .true.,  
00072       .true.,  
00073       .true.,  
00074       .true.,   
00075       .true.,  
00076       .true.,  
00077       .true.,  
00078       .true.  /)
00079   
00080   
00081   !----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00082 
00083   contains
00084 
00085 
00086     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00087     ! bianchi2_error
00088     !
00089     !! Display error message corresponding to error_code and halt program 
00090     !! execution if required.
00091     !!
00092     !! Variables:
00093     !!   - error_code: Integer error code.
00094     !!   - [procedure]: Procedure name where bianchi2_error called from.  Displayed 
00095     !!     when error message printed to screen.
00096     !!   - [comment_add]: If present, additional comment to append to default 
00097     !!     error comment.
00098     !!   - [comment_out]: If present the error comment is copied to comment_out
00099     !!     on output.
00100     !!   - [halt_in]: If present overrides default halt value.
00101     !
00102     !! @author J. D. McEwen
00103     !! @version 0.1 August 2004
00104     !
00105     ! Revisions:
00106     !   August 2004 - Written by Jason McEwen
00107     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00108 
00109     subroutine bianchi2_error(error_code, procedure, comment_add, &
00110       comment_out, halt_in)
00111 
00112       integer, intent(in) :: error_code
00113       character(len=*), intent(in), optional :: procedure, comment_add
00114       character(len=*), intent(inout), optional :: comment_out
00115       logical, intent(in), optional :: halt_in
00116 
00117       logical :: halt
00118       character(len=*), parameter :: comment_prefix = 'BIANCHI2_ERROR: '
00119 
00120       !---------------------------------------
00121       ! Display error message
00122       !---------------------------------------
00123 
00124       if(present(procedure)) then
00125 
00126         if(present(comment_add)) then
00127           write(*,'(a,a,a,a,a,a,a,a)') comment_prefix, 'Error ''', &
00128             trim(error_comment(error_code+1)), &
00129             ''' occured in procedure ''', &
00130             trim(procedure), &
00131             '''', &
00132             ' - ', trim(comment_add)
00133         else
00134           write(*,'(a,a,a,a,a,a)') comment_prefix, 'Error ''', &
00135             trim(error_comment(error_code+1)), &
00136             ''' occured in procedure ''', &
00137             trim(procedure), &
00138             ''''
00139         end if
00140  
00141      else
00142 
00143         if(present(comment_add)) then
00144           write(*,'(a,a,a,a)') comment_prefix, &
00145             trim(error_comment(error_code+1)), &
00146             ' - ', trim(comment_add)
00147         else
00148           write(*,'(a,a)') comment_prefix, trim(error_comment(error_code+1))
00149         end if
00150 
00151       end if
00152 
00153       ! Copy error comment if comment_out present.
00154       if(present(comment_out)) comment_out = error_comment(error_code+1)
00155 
00156       !---------------------------------------
00157       ! Halt program execution if required
00158       !---------------------------------------
00159       
00160       if( present(halt_in) ) then
00161         halt = halt_in
00162       else
00163         halt = halt_default(error_code+1)
00164       end if
00165 
00166       if( halt ) then
00167         write(*,'(a,a,a,a,a)') comment_prefix, &
00168           '  Halting program execution ', &
00169           'due to error ''', trim(error_comment(error_code+1)), ''''
00170         stop
00171       end if
00172 
00173     end subroutine bianchi2_error
00174 
00175 
00176 end module bianchi2_error_mod
